workflow.name: Automate Singapore COE price analysis & purchase timing with GLM-4.5 AI predictions
workflow.description:
## Introduction
Automates Singapore COE price tracking, predicts trends using AI, and recommends optimal car purchase timing. Scrapes LTA data biweekly, analyzes historical trends, forecasts next 6 bidding rounds, and sends alerts when buying windows appear‚Äîsaving time and identifying cost-saving opportunities.

## How it Works
Biweekly trigger scrapes LTA COE data ‚Üí processes historical trends ‚Üí AI predicts 6-month prices ‚Üí compares current vs forecast ‚Üí generates buy/wait recommendations ‚Üí alerts sent via Gmail or Telegram.

## Setup Steps
1. Add NVIDIA/OpenAI API credentials in n8n
2. Connect Google Sheets for data storage
3. Authenticate Gmail/Telegram for notifications
4. Schedule trigger for Wednesdays 8PM SGT
5. Configure alert thresholds in conditional nodes

## Workflow
Schedule Trigger ‚Üí HTTP Request (Scrape LTA) ‚Üí Data Processing ‚Üí Google Sheets (Store) ‚Üí AI Prediction ‚Üí Analysis Engine ‚Üí Conditional Logic ‚Üí Gmail/Telegram Notification

## Workflow Steps
1. Scraping: Extract COE prices from OneMotoring
2. Processing: Calculate moving averages, volatility, seasonal trends
3. Storage: Save to Google Sheets with timestamps
4. Prediction: AI forecasts next 6 bidding rounds
5. Analysis: Compare current vs predicted prices, generate recommendation
6. Notification: Alerts via email/Telegram

## Prerequisites
NVIDIA/OpenAI API key, Google account (Sheets), Gmail/Telegram for notifications, basic COE category knowledge

## Use Cases
First-time buyers monitoring price dips, fleet managers timing bulk purchases

## Customization
Add economic indicators, integrate car loan calculators, track parallel imported car prices

## Benefits
Saves hours of manual monitoring, captures 10‚Äì15% price dips, provides data-driven purchase timing (potential $5K‚Äì$15K savings)

workflow.name: Singapore COE Price Scraping & GLM-4.5 Prediction with Purchase Timing Recommendation

assignments.name: predictionPrompt

parameters.text:
=üö® *COE BUY ALERT* üö®

Optimal buying opportunity detected!

{{ Object.entries($json.recommendations)
  .filter(([_, rec]) => rec.action === 'BUY NOW')
  .map(([cat, rec]) => `*${cat}*: $${rec.currentPrice.toLocaleString('en-SG')}\nScore: ${rec.score}/100\n${rec.timingAdvice}`)
  .join('\n\n') }}

View full report in your email.

assignments.name: dashboardSummary

user.name: Cheng Siong Chin
user.bio: Dr. Cheng Siong CHIN is an n8n workflow creator specializing in AI-powered automation, agent orchestration, and intelligent system integrations. He designs and builds end-to-end workflows that combine LLMs, APIs, and data pipelines to streamline complex processes and deliver production-ready automation solutions. Contact me to discuss custom AI workflows and agent architectures.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
